creator: brownf@us.ibm.com
text:
The parser throws an exception for a filter property with equal such as
FILTER:alpha(opacity=30,enabled=1)

CSS2 grammar does not support this kind of constructs. The only supported
separators are spaces, ',' and '/'.
See: http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-CSS2/grammar.html
The SAC API only support CSS2 so it is not possible to create a LexicalUnit
representing "opacity=30,enabled=1".
creator: hillion@apache.org
brownf@us.ibm.com
text:
Thanks for the response. Filter is a proposed addition to CSSS and is, of 
course, already showing up on the microsoft related site which is where I found
the property.
